author: Huw
title: Official Brickset review
review:
I've just time to post a quick review of the second of three Friends animals series 2 sets: 41022 Bunny's Hutch, although to be honest there isn't a lot to say about it.

It consists of a bunny, a hutch (or rather, a fairly poor excuse for one), an exercise ramp and a carrot.

The hutch is a typical multi-coloured Friends affair, and pretty unremarkable. The exercise-ramp-thing is superfluous and probably just there to pad out the set a bit.

Like the hedgehog in 41020, the rabbit has appeared in other Friends sets, but this one sports a new print and is unique to this set.

Here's the hutch, with the hinged roof raised so you can see bunny in it. I've added a 2 x 2 jumper tile to the base so that he can sit centrally in it; for some reason one has not been provided.

Little girls, who of course it's designed to appeal to, will love this set, but it's not as appealing as the hedgehog hideaway for everyone else because the parts are not as useful. But, still worth 5 bucks of anyone's money...

If you want to see more details, Canadian Bounty Hunter has photos in his flickr set of the model and the parts.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Bunny's Hutch
review:
Set #41022 Bunny's Hutch: Finishing off Series 2 of the Animals Sub-Theme from LEGO Friends is this little number. Not exactly jaw dropping compared to Andrea's Bunny House, still it's a nice little place and includes a grey rabbit.

Pros

  • Grey bunny is a unique colour and has nice print detail.
  • The main model looks great and includes six of the 1x2 brick pieces sculpted to resemble real world bricks. In a nice light brown coloring.
  • Includes another carrot and two smaller builds that, well one's a nice little excercise piece for the bunny the other isn't much to write home about.

Cons

  • The carrot stem piece still looks too long when attached to the carrot, more of an aesthetic con really, it just looks wierd and I don't particularly care for it. (Other than that, no real cons to speak of.)

It's a great little set to have, great for stuffing the stocking, by the mantle, under the tree, where ever you might place it. This is a great set for parts too, especially that nice rare brick piece with the sculpted detail work in a rare colour. Strongly recommended.

author: BushMaoris
title: BUNNY RABBITS
review:
